Welcome to HW14 RestAPI’s documentation!¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify which contact to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is deleting their own contact and not someone else’s

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_all_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the first row to return

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to use

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The get_contact function is used to retrieve a contact from the database.
It takes in two arguments:

  1. The id of the contact you want to retrieve. This is an integer value, and it’s required.

  2. The user who owns this contact (the one who created it). This is a User object, and it’s required.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contact by user

Returns:

A contact object, or none if it doesn’t exist

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_birthday(birthday: date, n: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The get_contact_by_birthday function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within n days from the given date.
Args:

birthday (date): The date to compare against. n (int): The number of days after the given date to search for birthdays in.

Parameters:

  • birthday – date: Filter the contacts by their birthday

  • n:int – Determine how many days after the birthday to search for

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is only getting contacts from their own list

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is between the date passed as parameter and n days later

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(contact_email: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contact_by_email function takes in a contact_email and a user, and returns the contact with that email. If no such contact exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • contact_email – str: Filter the database for a contact with that email

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Make sure the user is only getting their own contacts

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n results

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass a database connection to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_name(contact_name: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts_by_name function takes in a contact name and returns all contacts with that name.

Parameters:

  • contact_name – str: Specify the name of the contact to be searched for

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the given name

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_surname(contact_surname: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts_by_surname function returns a list of contacts with the given surname.

Parameters:

  • contact_surname – str: Filter the contacts by surname

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

All contacts with the given surname

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactUpdateSchema): A ContactUpdateSchema object containing all fields that can be updated for a given user’s contacts. This is validated by pydantic before being passed into this function, so we don’t need to worry about it here.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user from the request

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes an email address and a database connection as arguments. It then uses the get_user_by_email function to retrieve the user with that email address from the database. It sets the confirmed field of that user to True, and commits those changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to confirm

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object, which is a sqlalchemy model

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user object associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url for a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Find the user in the database

  • url – str | None: Specify that the new url avatar parameter can either be a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_password(user: User, password: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_password function takes a user object, a password string, and an async database session. It sets the user’s password to the new given password and commits it to the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass in the user object that we want to update

  • password – str: Set the new password for the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the user’s refresh token in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user in the database,

  • token – str | None: Update the user’s refresh token

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database. It takes as input a ContactSchema object, which is validated against the ContactSchema schema. If validation fails, an HTTPException is raised with status_code 400 and details of what went wrong.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The contact it created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to delete. db (AsyncSession): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

An object of type contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_all_contacts function returns a list of all contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of a parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Specify the offset from which to start retrieving contacts

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of all contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact_by_email function is used to retrieve a contact by email. The function takes an email as input and returns the contact with that email.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the contact to be updated

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify that the limit must be greater than or equal to 10

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts that can be returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first offset contacts

  • ge – Specify that the limit must be greater than or equal to 10

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contacts for the current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_birthday(birthday: ~datetime.date = Query(2024-03-02), n: int = 7, db: ~sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.session.AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: ~src.models.models.User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_by_birthday function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays on the given date. If no date is provided, it will return contacts with birthdays for the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • birthday – date: Get the contacts with a birthday on that date

  • n – int: Specify the number of days to look ahead for birthdays

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_name(name: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_by_name function returns a list of contacts that match the name parameter. If no contact is found, it will return an empty list.

Parameters:

  • name – str: Specify the name of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts for the current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_surname(surname: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_by_surname function returns a list of contacts with the given surname.

Parameters:

  • surname – str: Get the surname of the contact that we want to find

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with the specified surname for the current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database. It takes an id, and a body containing the updated information for that contact. If successful, it returns the updated contact object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the data sent in the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current logged in user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and uses it to get their email address. Then, it checks if there is a user with that email in the database. If not, then an error message will be returned. If there is a user with that email, then we check if they have already confirmed their account or not by checking whether or not they are confirmed (True/False). If they are already confirmed, then we return another message saying so; otherwise we update them as being confirmed and

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_reset_passw(body: UserResetPassword, token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_reset_passw function is used to reset a user’s password.
It takes in the following parameters:

body: UserResetPassword - The new password for the user. token: str - The verification token sent to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body – UserResetPassword: Get the password from the user

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user. It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful. The access token can be used to make requests on behalf of that user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token, refresh token and the type of token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.recieve_conf_reset_passw()¶

The recieve_conf_reset_passw function is used to recieve confirmation for update password. It returns a JSON object with the message &quot;We recieved confirmation for update password&quot;.

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. The function takes in a refresh_token and returns an access_token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database session

Returns:

An access_token and a refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. The function then checks if the user exists and if they have already confirmed their account. If they have not, the function sends an email containing a link that will allow them to confirm their account.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message that the user can check their email for confirmation

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_passw_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_passw_email function is used to send an email with a link to reset the password. The user must enter his email and if it exists, he will receive an email with a link that will take him to the page where he can update his password.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Run the function asynchronously

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database. It takes a UserSchema object as input, and returns the newly created user. If an account with that email already exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_me(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_me function returns the current user’s information.
get:

summary: Get the current user’s information. description: Returns a UserResponse object containing all of the current user’s info, including their username and email address. This endpoint is protected by JWT authentication, so you must provide a valid token in order to access it.

Parameters:

user – User: Specify the type of data that will be returned

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_url(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_url function takes a file and user as input,

uploads the file to cloudinary, updates the avatar_url in the database and returns a UserResponse object.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object with the updated avatar_url

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • data – dict: Store the data that is to be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the time for which the token is valid

Returns:

A string of the encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶
The create_email_token function creates a token that is used to verify the user’s email address.
The token contains the following information:

  • iat (issued at): The time when the token was created.

  • exp (expiration): The time when this token will expire and no longer be valid. This is set to 1 day from creation by default, but can be changed in config.py if desired.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method a bound method, which means that the first parameter will always be

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded into a token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the data passed to it

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user. The function takes in two parameters: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary containing the user’s id, username, email address, and password hash. Expires_delta is an optional parameter that determines how long the refresh token will be valid for.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s data to be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiry time of the refresh token

Returns:

A jwt token with the following claims:

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes in a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail ‘Invalid scope for token’ or ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be called by FastAPI to retrieve the current user for each request. It uses the OAuth2PasswordBearer to validate and decode the JWT token in the Authorization header of each request.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function first tries to decode the token using jwt.decode, which will raise a JWTError if it fails to decode the token. If decoding is successful, then we return the email address from within the payload of our decoded JSON Web Token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address of the user who is requesting a password reset

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a recipient for the message. -username: this is used in the body of the message, and will be displayed in the letter in email-template.html. -host: this is where your website lives (e.g., &quot;localhost&quot; or &quot;127.0.0.1&quot;

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

Returns:

A coroutine object that we can await

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.email.send_reset_passw_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_reset_passw_email function sends an email to the user with a link to reset their password.
Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. username (str): The username of the account that is requesting a password reset.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Check if the email is valid

  • username – str: Get the username of the user who requested a password reset

  • host – str: Create the reset password link

Returns:

object that we can await

Doc-author:

Trelent
